xmlutil

Class XMLUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • xmlutil.XMLUtilities

  • public class XMLUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides general utility and helper methods for interacting with XML data. It is not a complete XML library by any means, but it has adequate funcationality for the library we will be building. A large portion of this class is taken from an example found in the following page on IBM developerWorks:
    • The Java XML Validation API

    • Field Detail

      • SCHEMA_STANDARD_SPEC_URL

        public static final java.lang.String SCHEMA_STANDARD_SPEC_URL
        The standard XML schema namespace. It is not the schema itself.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

        public XMLUtilities()
        Default constructor

    • Method Detail

      • validateXML

        public boolean validateXML(java.net.URL xmlFilePath,
                           java.net.URL xmlSchemapath)
        Validates the specified XML file against the specified XML Schema Definition (.xsd) file and returns true if and only if the validity check passes.
        Parameters:
        xmlFilePath - the specified XML file
        xmlSchemapath - the specified XML schema definition file
        Returns:
        true if the file is valid as per the schema, false otherwise.

      • loadXMLDocument

        public org.w3c.dom.Document loadXMLDocument(java.net.URL xmlFileURL,
                                            java.net.URL schemaFileURL)
                                     throws InvalidXMLFileFormatException
        Loads the specified XML file into a org.w3c.dom.Document and returns it.
        Parameters:
        xmlFileURL - the URL of the specified XML file
        schemaFileURL - the URL of the schema definition provided
        Returns:
        a normalized org.w3c.dom.Document object consisting of the data in the original XML file
        Throws:
        InvalidXMLFileFormatException - if the file cannot be validated against the given schema definition
        See Also:
        Document

      • getNodeWithName

        public org.w3c.dom.Node getNodeWithName(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                        java.lang.String tagName)
        Retrieves and return the node in the document that is an element of the type specified by the tag name. If no such element is found, then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        doc - the specified XML document
        tagName - the specified tag name
        Returns:
        The first node found named tagName. If none is found in the document, null is returned.

      • getTextData

        public java.lang.String getTextData(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                    java.lang.String tagName)
        This method extracts the data corresponding to the specified tag name in the given document, and returns it as a String. If no data is found, null is returned. This method can only handle unique tags in an XML file. If there are multiple occurrences of a tag, the behavior is unspecified.
        Parameters:
        doc - the DOM Document corresponding to a valid XML file
        tagName - the specified tag name
        Returns:
        the data (as a String) found in the element with the specified tag name, and null if there is no such data.

      • getChildrenWithName

        public java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> getChildrenWithName(org.w3c.dom.Node parent,
                                                            java.lang.String tagName)
        Retrieves and returns all children of the given parent node that have the specified tag name.
        Parameters:
        parent - the given parent node
        tagName - the specified tag name
        Returns:
        a list of child nodes of the type specified by the tag name
